title: How are the phone ROM and RAM allocated?
answer:
The ROM and RAM sizes displayed on your phone may be smaller than the values in the phone specifications, because the system occupies a part. A low configuration phone has 8 GB ROM and 1 GB RAM. A high configuration phone has 16 GB ROM and 2 GB RAM. 8 GB ROM The ROM contains system applications, files, and databases, which takes up about 4.1 GB and invisible to users. The ROM space visible and available to users is about 3.9 GB. Similar to a microSD card, you can use this 3.9 GB space to store any types of files. 1 GB RAM The Android system hides a part of the RAM for kernel running. Therefore, the displayed RAM is smaller than the value in the specifications. Low configuration phone
Factory Partition Settings of the Flash Memory (ROM) (Note: ROM Is Equivalent to the Hard Disk of a Desktop Computer) 8 GB
Partition Size Description How to Query
Partition for boot data and the operating system backup area About 50 MB This partition stores the data for a system boot (startup). In addition, it also stores the operating system backup data. When a user chooses to restore the phone to factory settings, the data in this partition is used. This partition is special. Users cannot query it, even using a third-party system application.
Partition for HOTA upgrades 256 MB This partition is reserved for HOTA upgrades and is used to store upgrade and patch files pushed by device providers and operators. This partition is special. Users cannot query it, even using a third-party system application.
System partition 1536 MB This partition is used by the Google Android operating system. This partition is special. Users cannot query it, even using a third-party system application.
Data partition About 3.92 GB This partition is used to store data required for running the operating system or applications. Application files installed by users are also placed in this partition. For example, if you install Angry Birds on your phone, the installation files are stored in this partition. Users can query this partition by choosing Settings > Storage.
Cust partition 512 MB This partition is used for customization information. Users can query this partition with a third-party system application.
Partition for other data About 486 MB This partition stores the mirror data, file partition table, flash bad block table, and lost space caused by formatting. This partition is special. Users cannot query it, even using a third-party system application.
Total 8 GB
All the preceding partition sizes are for your reference only. The size of each partition varies with specific versions.
Partition Settings of the Memory (RAM) (Note: RAM Is Equivalent to the Memory of a Desktop Computer) 1 GB
Partition Size Description How to Query
Bottom layer partition About 142 MB This partition shows the cache and bottom-layer wireless protocol stacks. This partition is special. Users cannot query it, even using a third-party system application.
Operating system and user partition About 882 MB This partition is used by the Android operating system and applications. Users can query it using a third-party system application. The size of this partition, however, may vary with the application used.
Total 1024 MB
All the preceding partition sizes are for your reference only. The size of each partition varies with specific versions.
High configuration phone
Factory Partition Settings of the Flash Memory (ROM) (Note: ROM Is Equivalent to the Hard Disk of a Desktop Computer) 16 GB
Partition Size Description How to Query
Partition for boot data and the operating system backup area About 50 MB This partition stores the data for a system boot (startup). In addition, it also stores the operating system backup data. When a user chooses to restore the phone to factory settings, the data in this partition is used. This partition is special. Users cannot query it, even using a third-party system application.
Partition for HOTA upgrades 256 MB This partition is reserved for HOTA upgrades and is used to store upgrade and patch files pushed by device providers and operators. This partition is special. Users cannot query it, even using a third-party system application.
System partition 1536 MB This partition is used by the Google Android operating system. This partition is special. Users cannot query it, even using a third-party system application.
Data partition About 11.65 GB This partition is used to store data required for running the operating system or applications. Application files installed by users are also placed in this partition. For example, if you install Angry Birds on your phone, the installation files are stored in this partition. Users can query this partition by choosing Settings > Storage.
Cust partition 512 MB This partition is used for customization information. Users can query this partition with a third-party system application.
Partition for other data About 486 MB This partition stores the mirror data, file partition table, flash bad block table, and lost space caused by formatting. This partition is special. Users cannot query it, even using a third-party system application.
Total 16 GB
All the preceding partition sizes are for your reference only. The size of each partition varies with specific versions.
Partition Settings of the Memory (RAM) (Note: RAM Is Equivalent to the Memory of a Desktop Computer) 2 GB
Partition Size Description How to Query
Bottom layer partition About 150 MB This partition shows the cache and bottom-layer wireless protocol stacks. This partition is special. Users cannot query it, even using a third-party system application.
Operating system and user partition About 1898 MB This partition is used by the Android operating system and applications. Users can query it using a third-party system application. The size of this partition, however, may vary with the application used.
Total 2048 MB
All the preceding partition sizes are for your reference only. The size of each partition varies with specific versions.
